data.title: Meta Interactive Feature
data.body:
This pull request adds a public method `set_meta_interactive(true)` that enables a `meta_mouse_hovering` signal that can be used. (For RichTextLabels)
Default value is false.

For example, we have the `meta_click` signal already. This pull request enables an optional signal for when the mouse is hovering.  This can be used to create interactive text within the RichTextLabel.

One example: http://i.imgur.com/mL9spc8.png

data.title: VisibilityNotifier2D doesn't notifies as soon as it's out of viewport
data.body:
**Godot version:** Built from master

VisibilityNotifier2D doesn't notifies as soon as it's out of viewport, there seem to be son kind of internal offset. It's the same for "exit_viewport" and "exit_screen" signal.

EDIT:

Here is a demo: 
[QuickTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/287543/QuickTest.zip) (Arrow keys to move the sprite/visibilitynotifier out the view)

data.title: Autogenerated collision shapes with script wont export as tileset collision shapes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I used an script to autogenerate an scene to export as a tileset, this script created a CollisionRectangle2D and assigned it to the CollisionShape nodes, however when i exported the scene as a tileset, all collision was null, but if i created a new collision rectangle from editor and assigned to a colision shape, that, and only that tile will have a collision...

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use this script to create an exportable scene with some collisions (scene should have a root node before runing it with Ctrl+Shift + R)
http://pastebin.com/1W9WB2Tg
(this script will use individual textures as tiles, you might need to change the path variables to use the right directories)

data.title: Weird rigid body behaviour
data.body:
What version are you on? 2.0.3 - Linux Mint 17.3

Whenever a rigid body stays with its center of mass away from an edge, it should starts rotating. The expected behaviour happens only if the collision shape is in one (maybe more) particular rotation state:

https://media.giphy.com/media/3oAt28ng9R3avLQVry/giphy.gif

data.title: Slow performance on Linux-based systems (hardware/driver dependent)
data.body:
Hello! 
My hardware: Intel Pentium E2200, 4 Gb RAM, ATI HD 4650. 
I use Arch Linux (but it doesn't matter, because I get the same performance on all Linux-based systems) with opensource videodriver on my PC. With each Godot versions I get 10-15 FPS in Truck Town sample. In an empty scene everything is better, but it is far from ideal. Work becomes impossible.

On Windows 8.1 with proprietary driver everything works fine.
By the way, I can't install proprietary driver on Arch, because AMD canceled the support of my card since 2013. 

Maybe there is a way to solve the problem?

data.title: Fixed caret colour not changing though properties
data.body: The caret colour now changes through properties for the TextEdit

data.title: Setting font on labels will crush the app on Android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Nexus 7, Android 6.0.1, Godot compiled @commit b777b3.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If I specify a font in a GUI node, e.g. Label, and deploy the app to Android, the app won't start, and stays in a loop showing Godot splash screen, crashing, and again.
This happens to both bitmap or dynamic fonts on this build. If a bitmap font is used, the same project works just fine running on Godot 2.0.3.

data.title: godot script: clone sub class (improvement)
Game windows focus/unfocus signal or properties
data.body:
How i can identify focus/defocus on Game window on PC|Mac platform? 

I use both keyboard and window draging as character control, but if key was been pressed and then window has been defocused or draged, keyboard action `Input.is_action_pressed` got stuck on `true` and resets only after focusing on window and pressing on another key.

data.title: Remove noisy print
data.body: The removed line prints ":1 /n 0" whenever a hinge joint is created.  This floods the debug log with useless noise.

data.title: Access editor font and other styles.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Any-Godot 2.1alpha

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

If we can access the font style and other styles of the editor(May be changed by user to non-default) we can keep the GUI of plugin with same look with editor.

The defaulit  font is too small on my reina laptop screen and it doesn't support Chinese characters. So I changed the font of editor and it works fine. I hope plugins can access and follow the font of editor's to keep same style and display with editor. If it is possible the developers of plugin will no have to add an extra font like this guy [TeddyDD/gtern](https://github.com/TeddyDD/gtern)

data.title: Better property ranges
Inspector ranges
data.body: Some of the inspector ranges are exagerated, for example why node2D rotation goes from -1440 to 1440, instead of -360 to 360, or light2D energy from -some_big_number to some_big_number, even though energy set to negative does not have effect, and also going above 100 does not seem to have effect either.

data.title: ERROR: (draw_rect: Drawing is only allowed inside NOTIFICATION_DRAW, _draw() function or 'draw' signal.) while accessing a child from _draw()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04
Godot 2.0.2 stable
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
get_child() in _draw function returns 
ERROR: draw_rect: Drawing is only allowed inside NOTIFICATION_DRAW, _draw() function or 'draw' signal.
   At: scene/2d/canvas_item.cpp:695.

**Steps to reproduce:**
parent Node2D with child 300x300 Sprite
simplest script I could come up with to replicate attached to Node2d:

```
extends Node2D

func _ready():
    var curPos = Vector2(get_viewport().get_rect().size.width/2, get_viewport().get_rect().size.height/2)
    self.set_pos(curPos)

func _draw():
    get_child(0).draw_rect(get_child(0).get_item_rect(),Color(1,0,0,0.1))
```

attaching script to child and replacing get_child with self works fine.
when I run:

```
print(get_child(0).get_item_rect())
```

is returning -150,-150,300,300
so its seen it as it should be. Is this a bug?(error message is somewhat strange considering its inside _draw)Does something have to be overridden that I'm not aware of or is this simply not the way to go about this? Thank you in advance.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: fix unexpected char: '\' error on windows for android module
Upon opening Godot, it runs the last project instead of opening project list or even the editor.
data.body:
**OS:**
Windows 10 Home edition

Can reproduce on these Godot versions:
2.0.2 and 2.0.3 win64
2.0.3 win32

**Issue:**
Upon opening Godot, it runs the last project instead of going to project list, or even going to editor.
Only way I can go back to project list or editor is editing engine.cfg and removing main_scene line.
I have to re-open the scene and assign it on project settings as main scene again.
If I close Godot and re-open it, same thing happens again.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Start new project from scratch.
Set main_scene in project settings.
Run project.
Save it.
Quit.
Open Godot......issue.

**Project upload:**
I'm sorry but I cannot upload the project, it is VERY SMALL though, nothing weird, just a few nodes with AnimatedSprite and AnimationPlayer.

Ubuntu 14.04
In FileSystem I want to move tileset.gd to my /scripts folder

```
move file res://tileset.gd -> /tileset.gd
found files to remap: 0
moving file res://tileset.gd to /tileset.gd
ERROR: add_io_error: Error moving file:
res://tileset.gd

   At: tools/editor/editor_node.cpp:4003.
call rescan!
```

data.title: 2D Soft Shadows
data.body:
It would be nice to have 2d soft shadows in Godot.

![hard_shadow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1985669/15478160/0681fc36-2119-11e6-8fb4-c60d7e11f6c8.png)

As you can see, this doesn't look ok. I used CanvasModulate with a black color to remove the "global" light.

Something like the following would be way better:

![soft_shadow](http://kortham.net/temp/upshot_NJAvp9K4.png)

Actually, the option to put the light above/under a Sprite would also be useful (as seen here: [http://godotengine.org/qa/1588/how-to-disable-self-shadowing-in-2d?show=1789#c1789](http://godotengine.org/qa/1588/how-to-disable-self-shadowing-in-2d?show=1789#c1789))

data.title: use node name as filename when save scene
[TRACKER] Scene Inheritance related issues
data.body:
### This is a tracker for issues related to Scene Inheritance:
- [x]  IMPORT:: New meshes introduced into scene lose their name https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2223 (bug)
- [x] "Parse Error: Unexpected end of file" in inherited .tscn files https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3897 (bug)
- [x] Inherited scenes: float variables always seen as custom, can't be reset https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4759 (bug)
- [x] Editing exported boolean of base scene child is not working in inherited scene  https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3904 (bug)
- [x] Inherited scene saving parent nodes in incorrect order https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3945 (bug)
- [x] Scenes are unable to remember it's nodes fold state https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3395 (bug) 
- [x] Tscn/tres: Inconsistencies in the extension filters of the save/open file dialogs https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2946 (enhancement)
- [x] Signal already connected" error in inherited scenes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6106 (bug)
- [x] CollisionShapes related issues https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5798, https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8103 (bug/enhancement)
- [x] Inherited Models don't hold information about textures/mappings https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10147 (bug)
- [ ] Exported vars not immediately updating for inherited scenes. https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5997 (bug)
- [ ] Impossible to change physic mode for instanced/inherited physic objects https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6216 (bug)
- [ ] Sub-inherited scene is not updated properly in the editor https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7984 (bug)
- [ ] Scripts Not Added to Instanced Scenes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10156#issuecomment-320997658 (bug)
- [ ] Ability to modify Animation player in inherited scenes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6169 (enhancement)
- [ ] Ability to change node type of inherited scene https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6215 (enhancement)
- [ ] Ability to extend base scene script easily for inherited scenes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4585 (enhancement)
- [ ] Document new scene inheritance concept https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3354 (docs)

data.title: Support for Android N beta
data.body:
**Windows 10, Godot 2.0.3**

I'm seeing inconsistent results when deploying to Android N Beta. I realise this wouldn't be 'supported' but I thought I'd report anyway. For example when deploying the Genetic Programming Godot demo I get this:

```
Installing into device (please wait..): Google Nexus 6P
running cmdline: "H:/Android/sdk/platform-tools/adb.exe" "-s" "CVH7N15B30002131" "install" "-r" "C:\
Users\UserName\AppData\Roaming/Godot/tmp/tmpexport.apk"
13510 KB/s (6824426 bytes in 0.493s)
Success
running cmdline: "H:/Android/sdk/platform-tools/adb.exe" "-s" "CVH7N15B30002131" "shell" "am" "start
" "-a" "android.intent.action.MAIN" "-n" "org.godotengine.geneticprogrammingsimulation/org.godotengine.godot.Godot"
Starting: Intent { act=android.intent.action.MAIN cmp=org.godotengine.geneticprogrammingsimulation/org.godotengine.godot.Godot }
Error type 3
Error: Activity class {org.godotengine.geneticprogrammingsimulation/org.godotengine.godot.Godot} does not exist.

```

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Install Android N Beta on a device
- Import the Genetic Programming Godot demo to Godot
- Perform a one-click deploy to the device (I have project defaults set)
- Observe the above error

I've also tried the Drag/Drop GUI demo and that deploys and runs ok.
Another project installed but when I ran it the screen was flashing/strobing badly on the splash screen.
My own project gets a similar error to the above.

Should I assume Android N support will come later and wait, or can something be done to make it work?
